title: Aadesh Shrivastava was extra special to Amitabh Bachchan
text:
The Hindi cinema icon is reportedly giving a break to the music composer's young son Anivesh.
READ: Amitabh Bachchan: Don't ask me where I get energy from
Listen to songs of Amitabh Bachchan on Gaana.com
It is little over a month since music composer Aadesh Shrivastava lost his battle with cancer. However, not a day goes by without the Indian cinema icon Amitabh Bachchan remembering his friend. Despite having a 22-year age gap, the duo had a very strong friendship. Sources say that when Big B learnt about Aadesh's terminal illness, not only was he heartbroken but he also took it upon himself to learn everything that he could about the late composer's medical condition. A source close to both the actor and the composer, says that it was the Bollywood icon who came forward and bore all the expenses of Aadesh's treatment in India and overseas.
But that is still not what their friendship was all about. It was the fact that though he was devastated with the news of Aadesh's illness, Big B took it upon himself to keep the music composer's spirits high. Late into the night, the megastar would go to Aadesh's music studio and the two of them would create tunes and sing. Never once did the veteran let it be known to Aadesh that he had any count to worry. What is most touching now is the fact that Bachchan has roped in Aadesh's son, Anivesh, to compose music for one of his upcoming television shows , which is about to go on air shortly.
